text: The Unfaithful Wife
Say to your brother,\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Hebrew “brothers” \f* “Ammi,”\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Ammi means “My people” \f*
and to your sister,\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Hebrew “sisters” \f* “Ruhamah.”\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Ruhamah means “Pitied” \f*
Plead with your mother, plead—
because she \add is\add* not my wife,
and I \add am\add* not her husband.
Let her put away her whoring ⸤from before her⸥,\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Literally “from her face” \f*
and her adultery from between her breasts.
Lest I strip her naked
and expose her like the day when she was born;
I will make her like the desert
and turn her into parched land;
I will kill her with thirst.
And I will not have pity on her children,
because \add they are\add* children of whoredom.
Because their mother was unfaithful;\f + \fr 2:5 \ft Or “their mother played the whore” \f*
she who conceived them has acted shamefully,
for she said:
“I will go after my lovers,
the ones who give \add me\add* my bread, my water,
my wool, and my flax,
my oil, and my drink.”
Therefore, Look!
I \add am\add* going to hedge her path\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Hebrew “your path” \f* ⸤with thorns⸥,\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Literally “with the thorns” \f*
and I will build a stone wall, a stone wall \add against\add* her,
and she will not find her paths.
Then she will pursue ⸤her lovers⸥,\f + \fr 2:7 \ft Literally “the ones who love her” \f*
but she will not overtake them;
she will seek them and not find \add them\add*;
and she will say, “I will go
and return to my first husband
because \add it was\add* better for me then than now.”
But she did not know
that \add it was\add* I who gave her
grain, new wine, and oil,
and who gave her silver in abundance,
and gold which they made into a Baal.
Therefore I will take again
my grain in its time,
and my wine in its season;
and I will take away my wool and my flax,
\add which were\add* to cover her nakedness.
And now I will uncover her nakedness
before the eyes of her lovers,
and no one will rescue her from my hand.
And I will put an end to all her mirth,
her festivals,\f + \fr 2:11 \ft Hebrew “festival” \f* her new moons,\f + \fr 2:11 \ft Hebrew “new moon” \f* and her Sabbaths,\f + \fr 2:11 \ft Hebrew “Sabbath” \f*
and all her appointed festivals;\f + \fr 2:11 \ft Hebrew “festival” \f*
and I will lay waste to her vines\f + \fr 2:12 \ft Hebrew “vine” \f* and her fig trees,\f + \fr 2:12 \ft Hebrew “fig tree” \f*
of which she said,
“They \add are\add* my payment for prostitution,
which my lovers gave to me.”
I will make them a forest,
and the wild animals\f + \fr 2:12 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* of the field will devour them.
⸤I will punish her⸥\f + \fr 2:13 \ft Literally “To visit sins upon her;” see 1:4 \f* \add for\add* the days of the Baals,
to whom she burns incense,
and she decked herself \add with\add* her ornamental ring and jewelry,
and she went after her lovers, and forgot me
—a declaration of Yahweh.
Therefore, Look! I \add am\add* going to allure her
and bring her \add into\add* the desert,
and ⸤I will speak tenderly to her⸥.\f + \fr 2:14 \ft Literally “I will speak to her heart” \f*
From there I will give her
her vineyards,
and the Valley of Achor as a doorway of hope.
And there she will respond,
as \add in\add* the days of her youth,
just as \add in\add* the day of her coming out of
the land of Egypt.
⸤And on that day⸥—\f + \fr 2:16 \ft Literally, “And it will happen on that day” \f*
a declaration of Yahweh—
you will call me, “My husband;”\f + \fr 2:16 \ft Hebrew “Ishi” \f*
you will no longer call me, “My Baal.”\f + \fr 2:16 \ft Hebrew “Baali” \f*
I will remove the names
of the Baals from her mouth,
and they will no longer be mentioned by their name.
I will make a covenant for them on that day,
with the animals\f + \fr 2:18 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* of the field,
with the birds\f + \fr 2:18 \ft Hebrew “bird” \f* of the heaven, and
\add with\add* the creeping things\f + \fr 2:18 \ft Hebrew “creeping thing” \f* of the ground;
\add the\add* bow, \add the\add* sword, and \add the\add* war I will abolish from the land, and I will let them lie down in safety.
And I will take you as my wife forever;
I will take you as a wife for myself in righteousness and in justice,
in steadfast love and in mercy.
⸤I will take you as my wife⸥\f + \fr 2:20 \ft Literally “I will take you as a wife to me” \f* in faithfulness,
and you will know Yahweh.
On that day I will answer, ⸤declares Yahweh⸥,\f + \fr 2:21 \ft Literally “a declaration of Yahweh \f*
I will answer the heavens,
and they will answer the earth.
And the earth will answer
the grain, the wine, and the oil,
and they will answer Jezreel.\f + \fr 2:22 \ft Jezreel means “God sows” \f*
I will sow her for myself in the land;
I will have pity on Lo-ruhama;\f + \fr 2:23 \ft Lo-ruhama means “Not pitied” \f*
I will say to Lo-ammi,\f + \fr 2:23 \ft Lo-ammi means “Not my people” \f*
“You are my people,”
and he himself will say, “\add you are\add* my God.”
